noun.description: Synthetic resin or plastic consisting of polyvinyl chloride or a related polymer, used especially for wallpapers and other covering materials and for phonograph records.
examples: light-reflecting vinyls can be hung in the usual way

noun.description: Of or denoting the unsaturated hydrocarbon radical —CH=CH₂, derived from ethylene by removal of a hydrogen atom.

origin: Mid 19th century: from Latin vinum wine + -yl.
